content:
Face masks can be a wonderful addition to your skincare routine, and there are many affordable options available. For combination skin, you'll want to look for masks that balance hydration and oil control. Here are some affordable face mask recommendations:

1. **Sheet Masks:**
	* Neutrogena Hydro Boost Water Gel Sheet Mask (around $3) - A hydrating sheet mask that provides long-lasting moisture without feeling greasy.
	* L'Oréal Paris Pure-Clay Detox & Brighten Face Mask (around $3) - A clay-based sheet mask that helps control oil and purify the skin.
2. **Clay Masks:**
	* Aztec Secret Indian Healing Clay (around $8) - A popular, affordable clay mask that helps absorb excess oil and purify the skin. Mix with water or apple cider vinegar to create a paste.
	* Garnier Skin Renew Dark Spot Treatment Mask (around $10) - A clay-based mask that helps reduce the appearance of dark spots and hyperpigmentation.
3. **Cream Masks:**
	* Olay Regenerist Micro-Sculpting Cream Mask (around $10) - A rich, anti-aging cream mask that helps plump and firm the skin.
	* SheaMoisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Mask (around $12) - A hydrating cream mask that helps nourish and balance the skin.

When choosing a face mask, consider your specific skin concerns (e.g., acne, dryness, hyperpigmentation) and look for ingredients that address those issues. For combination skin, you may want to opt for masks that are labeled "balancing" or "hydrating" to help control oil and provide moisture.

Remember to always follow the instructions for the specific mask you choose, and be sure to patch test before applying it to your entire face.
